page.title: 05Bridgerule Primary School
page.content: Bridgerule Primary School Today The primary school is situated in the middle of the village in a delightful setting backing onto farmland. Although old the school is in remarkably good condition having had an extension comprising indoor toilets and an extra classroom built in 1957. The organisation is based on a staffing level of Headteacher plus 1.1 assistant teachers. At present the infants (4+-7years) are taught in one room and the juniors (7+-11years) are taught in the other main classroom which doubles as a dining room. Midday meals are no longer cooked on the premises but are sent by road from Holsworthy Primary 6 miles away. The school has its own tiny outdoor swimming pool but unfortunately no adequate playing field.N.O.R.approx.30
